text: Bomarea brachysepala is a species of flowering plant in the family Alstroemeriaceae. It is native to Peru and Ecuador.Kew World Checklist of Selected Plant Families It grows in mountain forest habitat in the Andes. It is threatened by destruction of habitat caused by deforestation and mining.Mogollón, H. and N. Pitman. 2003. Bomarea brachysepala. In: IUCN 2012. IUCN Red List of Threatened Species.
